required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dual-Task Effects on Hand Functions in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Dual-Task on Hand Functions in Individuals With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to examine the effect of dual-task performance on hand skills in individuals with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus. It is planned to reach at least 100 participants during the data collection phase of the study. Demographic information, plasma glucose levels, and HbA1C levels of the participants included in the study will be recorded. The upper extremity problems of the participants will be recorded. Minnesota Manual Dexterity Test will be used to evaluate upper extremity functions.

primary_outcome.description: The test consists of two parts, "placing" and "turning". The patient is instructed to put disks to the holes and the test time uses as a score, in the placing test. In the turning test, patient is instructed to turn the disks before putting the holes. The test time is recorded. The test will performe with and without dual-task and the dual task effect will calculate.

Each patient is going to be instructed to perform The Minnesota Dexterity Test with and without dual-task. Firstly, patients are going to perform the two parts of the test without dual-task. Secondly, patients are going to perform two parts of the test while counting down 3 by 3 from a random three-digit number. The percentage of difference is going to calculate as the dual-task effect.

arm_group.description: People without type 2 diabetes and prediabetes

intervention.description: In the study, both groups are going to evaluate with and without dual-task. The dual-task will be counting back down 3 by 3 from a three-digit number.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Having been diagnosed with T2DM for at least 5 years for study group, having no diagnosed type 2 diabetes mellitus or prediabetes for control group,
- Being able to count down 3 by 3 from a three-digit number,
- Volunteer to take part in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of traumatic or inflammatory injury in the upper extremity,
- History of involving the upper extremity in the last year,
- Having rheumatological/inflammatory arthritis or deformity,
- Having a deformity caused by osteoarthritis in the upper extremity,
- Having a neurological problem affecting the upper extremity,
- Getting 23 points or less on the Mini-Mental Test.
